definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: If Saturn be in Aquarius, he will be a mere woman-hater.
sentences.chinese: 如果土星位於水瓶座，盤主會很討厭女性。

sentences.english: A corollary of that is I hate flag waving.
sentences.chinese: 以上導致的必然結果是，我討厭國旗揮舞。

sentences.english: Unsolicited advice is perceived as annoying. Don’t do it.
sentences.chinese: 未經請求的建議也會令人討厭，所以不要那麼做。

sentences.english: Hate does not feel disgusting of war.
sentences.chinese: 討厭卻不能撕破臉的感覺真噁心。

sentences.english: He hated the way I called him out.
sentences.chinese: 他其實很討厭我那樣衝他嚷。

sentences.english: People call him bad breath because he is ugly.
sentences.chinese: 人們叫他討厭鬼就是因爲他很醜。

sentences.english: I hate to play a deep game.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭玩深奧難懂的遊戲。

sentences.english: What one person considers great design could be hated by another.
sentences.chinese: 一個人認爲偉大的設計可能是另一個人討厭的。

sentences.english: I hate bugs, they give me the willies.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭蟲子，他們使我很害怕。

sentences.english: He hates cartoons, so every time he sees them he .
sentences.chinese: 他討厭動畫片，所以每次看見了他都轉檯。
媽媽的咖啡是我討厭的。

sentences.english: You've postured until everyone's sick of you.
sentences.chinese: 你裝模作樣，直到大家都討厭你。

sentences.english: The citizens are disgusted with the factory because of the pollution that the factory has caused.
sentences.chinese: 由於這家工廠製造成污染，居民們對它極爲討厭。

sentences.english: You meet someone you hate and you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 你遇到了你討厭的人時你會發怒。

sentences.english: I hate such shallow false pretences.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭這種膚淺，虛僞的做作。

sentences.english: I always hate phony people like that.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都很討厭像他那樣的騙子。

definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
